history.content:
You'll have to fill in a Google form expressing your interest, which is released sometime before the semester begins. Due to limited space for undergrads, the application is highly competitive.

This spring, getting an A/A+ in CS 189 was a hard requirement. Apart from that, grades in other relevant classes such as CS 188, CS 184, CS 194-26, CS 294-129, EE 123, etc. were taken into account. Lastly, TAing for any of the above courses or research with AI faculty was also considered. To maximize your chances, I guess you'd have to look into taking at least a few of the above classes.

Lastly, TAing for any of the above courses or research with AI faculty was also considered. To maximize your chances, I guess you'd have to look into taking at least a few of the above classes.

This spring, getting an A/A+ in CS 189 was a hard requirement. Apart from that, grades in other related classes such as CS 184, CS 194-26, EE 120, etc. were also taken into account. To maximize your chances, I guess you'd have to look into taking at least a few of the above classes.

children.subject: Wow I didn't know there were so many requirements to taking that class. R.I.P
^ Agreed. CS194-26 also covered many topics in 280 as well
Cool. Thanks! Will def be taking those two then.
Beyond image recognition, deep learning has not been super successful in computer vision, particularly in working with geometry.

Took 280 this semester and it was pretty disappointing as undergrad. I was expecting to learn and actually implement deep learning techniques but it was mostly traditional CV and graphics and there were no pytorch/tensorflow assignments other than the final project. If you are taking 189 this semester, definitely take cs 194-129, which will cover deep learning for CV and NLP. If you are still interested in 280, I'd say CS 184 and CS 194-26 are enough and here's the link to the lecture as well:

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLkFD6_40KJIxge3DKNXckQ8YMvBWH70dm

history.content: Hi what is the policy on taking grad courses as an undergrad? I would like to take the computer vision course after taking 189 as i looked through the course materials and it sounds super cool. Can I take this course without getting kicked? Thanks!
history.subject: CS 280 as an undergrad
